Topic.Title: Google shares slides on prematurely announced earnings

Message.Msg: And what's Jen's fanciful "guidance" again? "NVIDIA Corp announced that for the third quarter of 2013, it expects revenue to be between $1.15 billion and $1.25 billion." None of the analysts believed him, of course. "According to I/B/E/S Estimates, analysts are expecting the Company to report revenue of $1.04 billion for the third quarter of 2013." Google it : NVIDIA Corp Issues Q3 2013 Revenue Guidance Below Analysts' Estimates

Message.Title: And what's Jen's fanciful "guidance" again?
Message.Msg: And what's Jen's fanciful "guidance" again? "NVIDIA Corp announced that for the third quarter of 2013, it expects revenue to be between $1.15 billion and $1.25 billion." None of the analysts believe him, of course. "According to I/B/E/S Estimates, analysts are expecting the Company to report revenue of $1.04 billion for the third quarter of 2013." Google it : NVIDIA Corp Issues Q3 2013 Revenue Guidance Below Analysts' Estimates

So Best? It appears most of the best analysts don't care what current CEO Jen's guidance is. Nope. It doesn't matter. They just adjust their nvda spreadsheets as each one of nvidia's customers report their plunging results.

Message.Title: $666 million of Nexus 7 sales
Message.Msg: From Google's earnings call: " And our other revenue grew 73% year-over-year to $666 million, 52% quarter-over-quarter and this driven by the Nexus 7 sales." Any guesstimates of how many Tegra's that is? :) source: seeking alpha transcript

Message.Title: Getting painted with the Marvel/Intel brush
Message.Msg: If at the worst this is a zero sum game they are missing who the winners are. NVDA is in the winners block.

Topic.Title: Getting painted with the Marvel/Intel brush

Message.Msg: If it's a zero sum game, Apple would be THE Most Valuable Company on the Planet. In the History of Mankind.

Q : "Any guesstimates of how many Tegra's that is?" A : Probably enough for Google to start making their own ARM chips. And cut out the middleman. Like Apple and Samsung do -- and Amazon soon will too.
Actually it does make sense for Google to buy Nvidia, not only because of the Tegra division also the whole explosive cloud/data center technology that Nvidia is pioneering.

Topic.Title: Getting painted with the Marvel/Intel brush

Message.Msg: While we do think NVIDIA is the most resilient PC chip stock in the sector today thanks to its ‘premium’ product positioning in PCs (GPUs are a luxury item), its growth strategies in mobile, and its growing parallel compute server business, shares have been quite resilient Putting my money where my mouth is. Thank goodness we didn't get another upgrade...sold off after each one. Funny how they are "used" for buying and selling.

Message.Title: FBR Capital : “We are downgrading shares of NVDA."
Message.Msg: "FBR Capital analyst Craig Berger this morning reduced his ratings on Advanced Micro Devices, Marvell and Nvidia, citing the continuing weak condition of the personal computer market. Note that AMD after the close yesterday reported grim Q3 results, while Marvell chopped its guidance for its October quarter." "Nvidia: Rating to Market Perform from Outperform. “We are downgrading shares of NVDA … as we meaningfully reduce exposure to PC chip stocks given ongoing Demand Weakness, Poor Reports about Win8 uptake and consumer receptivity, and continuing smartphone/tablet cannibalization impacts." Looks like the PC parts makers -- like nvidia -- are now decidedly out-of-fashion, boys.

Topic.Title: FBR Capital : “We are downgrading shares of NVDA."

Message.Msg: For those left searching for words, here they are. Google this : Chips: FBR Cuts Views On MRVL, AMD, NVDA On PC Woes

I caught this in the call yesterday... but was a little troubled by the math. 666/1.52 = $438.6, about leaving about $228M in Q/Q growth. Given the retail price around the world from the play store, and and assumed ASAP of approximately $225, that'd suggest roughly 1M Nexus 7's have been sold from the play store. This is less than I had expected. I don't think this 1M number represents all Nexus 7 sales -- just those sold directly from Google -- but that it should capture all of the 8GB model sales in the quarter (since I think Google doesn't distribute that model through any other channels). 1M is less than I thought.

"I don't think this 1M number represents all Nexus 7 sales -- just those sold directly from Google", writes thetrade50, desperately. Those sold by others appear on Google's "Other" 10-Q Income Statement, right? HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA!

Topic.Title: Nvidia's Top End Kepler Unveiled: Tesla K20 Comes with Disappointing Specs, Performance

Message.Msg: 'As it stands right now, the K20 will barely outperform the Xeon Phi' In theory, however in practice an x86 FLOP is far easily attainable than a gpu GLOP and easier to program too. If Nvidia is selling any Teslas/Quadros on workstation/FP apps they will be severely challenged by your old friend Larrabee. Watch PSB's profits closely for any dip as that will be a tell tale sign.

desperately? Are you arguing that Google should be accounting for all Nexus 7 sales? Nexus 7's are made by Asus, and at the time Andy Rubin made some comments about how revenue from the Play Store would show up in Google's numbers, but not all sales would. Also, in recent the past, Google's never included the device sales for any other Nexus Devices (e.g. the Galaxy Nexus or Nexus S). Are you arguing that's not the case? Why not just harp on the actual 1M number being lower than expectations, or explain why my math getting to that number is too optimistic.
Thanks for this guys!
just to fix one of my more egregious typos, I meant to write "at the time *of the Nexus 7 announcement*, Andy Rubin made some comments"

"Those sold by others appear on Google's "Other" 10-Q Income Statement, right?" No, wrong. Same reason you won't see device sales or the Galaxy Nexus, Nexus S, or any of the upcoming Nexus devices -- unless they're sold directly by Google, through Google Play.

Message.Msg: "In theory, however in practice an x86 FLOP is far easily attainable than a gpu GLOP and easier to program too." In many cases, but GPGPU will excel with others... "If Nvidia is selling any Teslas/Quadros on workstation/FP apps they will be severely challenged by your old friend Larrabee." Tesla will be challenged... especially with INtel's pricing... But a Quadro can have dual use... and Phi doesn't offer the GPU side

Message.Msg: I think they are going for the final kill to win the election...
buy order in @ $12.10.
NVDA is down more than a lot of the other chip companies. ie TXN and QCOM

Right, but there is always a more exaggerated sell pressure on a stock that is listed in a downgrade than the others that are not listed or cited. Plus, Nvidia is a high-beta stock and it also the last day for options today as well . . a perfect storm so to speak to see it drop this much. Don't forget that AMD and MRVL today which is part of that analyst's downgrade are both down over or around 15%(!!). Frankly, I'm more upset with this particular analyst because he could just as easily note that Nvidia is benefiting from AMD's fall rather than being a part of that fall. Of course, the analyst has no other motive to mention at this time right ;)? Rigggght.

Message.Title: Considering going long
Message.Msg: If this drops below 12 its hard not to bite on this. I bought in before last earnings and that worked out pretty well. I seem to remember them being pretty confident about the future as well. I would have to imagine Tegra 3 has done fairly well? Kinda surprised by the drop today, I guess its getting taken down by AMD and the market being down. Might be a good point to jump in seeing as earnings isn't too far off?
You'd be better off investing in AMD which dropped 16+ percent, or to MRVL, which dropped 15% You idiots made me LMAO!
You'd be better off investing in AMD which dropped 16+ percent, or to MRVL, which dropped 15% You idiots made me LMAO!
You'd be better off investing in AMD which dropped 16+ percent, or to MRVL, which dropped 15% You idiots made me LMAO!

IMO, it's a perfect storm to allow someone to buy at the bottom today. If I had the freed up capital, I'd be buying now. Also, you have to consider that both MRVL and AMD were lumped into the same analyst's update which were all downgrades, and those stocks were both down over 15% at one point. Add to that another options expiry and the general market being extremely skittish and you have the high beta NVDA go down a full half a point or 50c more than a day like this should normally cause.
I don't have any free capital until Monday morning, will see what this does Monday morning. Probably going to buy in if its the right price still.
This is what I am looking for.

Topic.Title: Sold in AH's at $12.11 - NVDA is dropping like a rock.............

Message.Msg: Hope you won't be regretted next week, it could bounce back easily to 12.43 where you brought. IMHO.

"It appears most of the best analysts don't care what current CEO Jen's guidance is. Nope. It doesn't matter. They just adjust their nvda spreadsheets as each one of nvidia's customers report their plunging results." Don't be sayin' that you weren't warned, boys. Oh no no no. nvidia had it's First Trip to the Woodshed today. WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! Because Jen didn't pre-warn and chop his fanciful guidance. LIKE REST OF THE PC PARTS MAKERS HAVE. But it's not over. Oh no no no. The Second Trip to the Woodshed will follow next week. Down she goes some more, boys. WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! As the grim news spreads to the slower sheep. That PC parts makers -- such as nvidia -- are decidedly out-of-fashion. Like that hapless nvda shareholder who spent the afternoon in the dentist's chair. And won't read the grim news until Sunday afternoon. After the football game. When the fresh crop of analyst downgrades are released. Then, the Third Trip to the Woodshed will come when Jen finally chops his guidance. Usually a week or so before his Quarterly Confessional. And comes clean on the fact that things aren't as rosy as that P/E of 15 might suggest. WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! Down she goes even more. Have you ever heard of a stock going Up after the CEO chops his guidance? Hummm? Of course not. Finally, nvda really sails off the flat side of the 52-Week Low List on "Earnings" Day. For some odd reason there's always those folks who don't believe the fore-telling of plunging revenues, margins and Net Income until they actually See it in black and white and red towards the bottom. All GAAP compliant and properly SEC filed. With footnotes describing the Extraordinary Charges and this and that. WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! Maybe a new Multi-Year Low for nvda is established the following day. Did I mention? Don't be sayin' that you weren't warned, boys.
That's what a loser likes you does at home by himself on Friday night...'whack wack whack'

Topic.Title: Sold in AH's at $12.11 - NVDA is dropping like a rock.............

Message.Msg: Some parts are done, but not Nvidia. There will be plenty of good news in the next few weeks. Today's reaction was an overreaction based on a number of things converging at once. If you actually 'thought' about it, you'd realize it was a great time to buy whether you got it at 12.11 or at 12.43. Bye bye.
